content: How can I help you today?

I guess I’m here because my wife said it was important. I’ve been having a hard time staying focused at work or even enjoying things I used to, and I know a lot of it stems from what’s going on at home. My son has been struggling, and my wife and I don’t seem to agree on the best way to help him, which is putting a lot of strain on our marriage. It just feels like everything is falling apart.

Thank you for sharing that—it sounds like you’re carrying a lot on your shoulders right now, with concerns about your son, your relationship with your wife, and how it’s all affecting your focus and enjoyment in life. It’s understandable for these challenges to feel overwhelming. What do you think is most important for you to talk about today?

I don’t even know where to start. I guess my son’s behavior is the most urgent thing. It’s been so hard. We’re trying to help him, but nothing seems to work, and my wife and I just keep arguing about it. It feels like we’re failing him and it’s tearing us apart. And honestly... I feel like I’m failing everyone.

It sounds like you’re feeling a lot of pressure and self-doubt, especially with your son’s challenges and the strain on your marriage. You care deeply about your family, and it’s clear you’re doing your best in a really tough situation. What does your son’s behavior look like, and what’s been most challenging for you about trying to help him?

He's been acting out a lot—tantrums, not listening, getting into trouble at school. It feels like no matter what we do, it doesn’t help or make things better. Sometimes I don't even know if I'm doing the right thing as a parent, and it's exhausting trying to keep up with it all. I just feel so lost.

That sounds incredibly exhausting and draining for you, especially when you’re trying so hard to do what's best for him but still feeling uncertain. It’s clear how much you care for your son and want to be a good parent. What changes do you wish you could see—for your son, for your family, or even for yourself?

Honestly, I just want to feel like we're making progress, like what we're doing is helping him somehow. I want my son to feel better, and I want my wife and I to feel like we’re on the same team again. And, if I’m being honest, I’d like to feel like myself... like I’m actually enjoying life, not just going through the motions.

You’re longing for progress—for your son’s well-being, for unity with your wife, and for rediscovering what brings you joy personally. That’s a lot to hope for, but it also shows how committed you are to making positive changes. What do you think could be a first step toward any one of these things?

Honestly, I don’t even know where to start. Maybe if my wife and I could work through our disagreements about how to help our son, we’d make progress there. But I also feel like I need to figure out how to manage my own stress better because right now, I’m not bringing my best self to anything. It feels like everything is just compounding.

It sounds like finding alignment with your wife and managing your own stress are two meaningful areas you see as steps toward positive change. You’ve already identified a lot here—your desire to be your best self and your hope to support your family. What might help you feel less overwhelmed as you think about approaching these challenges?

It’s hard to say, honestly. I feel like I’m just stuck in this cycle and trying to catch my breath most days. Maybe if I could have a better way to deal with my stress or at least learn how to not let it take over, I’d have more patience and clarity to handle everything else. I just don’t know where to even start with that.

It sounds like breaking that cycle—finding some relief from the stress—could help you regain patience and clarity to tackle the other challenges. You’re already recognizing how important your own well-being is in helping your family, which is a really insightful place to start. What are some ways you’ve coped with stress in the past, or things you’ve thought might be helpful to try?
Take your time—I’m here to listen whenever you’re ready. What feels most important to explore right now?

I’m not really sure, honestly. I guess I’ve tried to ignore it or power through it, but that’s clearly not working. I’ve thought about trying to exercise more or doing something to take my mind off things, but it’s just so hard to even find the motivation or the time. I feel stuck.

It’s challenging when powering through doesn’t work and even things like exercise or distractions feel out of reach. It sounds like you’re looking for relief but unsure how to begin, especially with everything on your plate. What would make it easier for you to prioritize even small moments for yourself or to find motivation?

It sounds tough to feel stuck like that, and I understand how overwhelming it can be to even think about where to begin. Maybe starting with something really small and manageable—just a few minutes of something that feels good for you—could help build a bit of momentum. Is there one small thing that feels doable right now, just for yourself?

Finding one small step that feels manageable can be a great way to start shifting things. What's one activity or moment you’ve enjoyed in the past that might help you take even a tiny step toward feeling more like yourself again?
I guess... maybe going for a quick walk? I used to enjoy that, but it’s been a long time. It might help me clear my head, but even that feels hard to fit in sometimes. Maybe I can try.

That’s a great idea. A quick walk might help clear your mind and give you a small sense of control, even on busy days. It’s encouraging that you’re open to trying. How can you make fitting it in feel a little easier—maybe setting aside just five or ten minutes to start?
